text:
Walked in on 2 Jan'24 (1st day of biz in NY). Bought a set of mini mahjong, foldable wooden table and tile rulers. No room for bargain at all but their price is indeed better than online. Quality of tiles is good as usual cos I'm a returning customer who have bought many times from them, including a solid wood foldable table which is now obsolete. Table quality is good.
Staff not very friendly though but importance is that I get what I what at a reasonable price ◡̈

Poor quality mahjong tiles. Played one time and many tiles turned blurry. Brought it back to the shop but they insist no exchange. At most they will TRY to “repair” only. When I tried to take photo of my set at the shop I was even being stopped. Avoid!

As others that had mentioned before, the auntie there indeed was quite rude. I had to take a couple of photos and send my friends in order to come to a conclusion on which set to buy but she kept mumbling stuff like oh you have taken all the photos already, still not buying? The range of mahjong was also not that huge.. But it is still a heritage shop as it had been around for at least 30+ years I think?

Purchased a set of A1 gold tiles at a reasonable price, good workmanship and beautifully crafted. Friendly and helpful staff who provided good advices on the tiles. Definitely will go back again for my subsequent tiles purchases. Physical visit is highly recommended.
Bought a set of A1 sized rummy mahjong. Good quality with distinct colours. Seller is helpful, friendly and patient.
